linux.message: If you have never used Pybricks with USB on Linux, you will need to configure udev rules before you can install the firmware. {learnMore}

windows.message: Are you using Pybricks on this computer for the first time? You may need to manually install the USB driver for this hub type. {instructions}

prepare.title: Prepare:
prepare.batteries: Make sure the hub has new or fully-charged batteries.
prepare.turnOff: Make sure the hub is turned off.
prepare.app: Open the {lego} PoweredUp app in 'Create' mode and start a new project.

bootloaderMode.title: Install:
bootloaderMode.disconnectIo: Disconnect any device from port A on the hub.
bootloaderMode.holdButton: Press and hold the {button} on the hub. {boldDoNotLetGo}
bootloaderMode.waitAppConnect: The app will automatically connect and start restoring the firmware.

connect.title: Install:
connect.clickConnectAndFlash: Click the {flashButton} button below. A popup will appear: click {deviceName}, then click {connectButton}.
